H0.text: Conclusion is what a hypothesis that is successfully tested many times may become.

H1.text: A theory is a hypothesis that is successfully tested many times.

H2.text: Constant is what a hypothesis that has been successfully tested many times may become.

H3.text: Law is a hypothesis that has been successfully tested many times.

A4.text: This explanation is also tested, and if it fulfills the necessary criteria (see above), then the explanation becomes a theory.

A5.text: Popper summarized these statements by saying that the central criterion of the scientific status of a theory is its 'falsifiability, or refutability, or testability'.
